Reviews.Title: “Easter Holliday”
Reviews.Author: Lene J
Reviews.Content: The best easter holliday ever... we were so satisfied with the hotel service and the room was so nice. the staff was very kind at all times. The restaurent made good food. the breakfast was really delicius, but the evening buffet was not so good. we can recommend it to everybody... a place we will come again

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, BAD dinner”
Reviews.Author: Endy2000
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, clean and nice hotel. A bit to modern if you ask me, wee suffert a bit of the lack of personality in the hotel, you feel a bit cut of from the rest of the community, there are no windows out to the street. The dinner we got as a part of the packet offer wee bought, were very bad, boring, and not enougt, so afterworth wee had to go to another resturant and eat another dinner. The breakfast on the hotel is olso very expencive compared to the value of it. The location of the hotel is good and it is very near to the U-bahn, so 15 min. and you are in the heart of BERLIN - Wonderfull city. All in all a nice stay, but don´t spend money on the food at the resurant.

Reviews.Title: “"Very Nice Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Rita C
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff and good location. But the breakfast is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “BAD DINNER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jens A
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - new, clean and with nice service, but i can't tell you how disappointed I was, when we got our dinner a the hotel! I can't remember ever having a so borring, over-cooked, sleesy and plain uneateble! Don't eat there even if it is included in your stay! I would rather have eaten at McDonalds and I don't like McDonalds! Everything else was fine...

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly staff, but boring ...”
Reviews.Author: Jens M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Berlin. The hotel is modern, rooms are nice and clear; you cannot put your finger on anything - except... Unlike Berlin, which is such a wonderful place, the hotel has no soul, nothing to get you exhited. So, if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep, it is a great hotel... We got our stay as part of a very attractive package deal. The deal included a dinner in the restaurant. Like the rest of the hotel, the restaurant is about as boring as you can imagine. A buffet allowed an ok selection of dishes, all of which matched perfectly the rest of the hotel and the restaurant - boring.... So, now you know :-) The transfer from Tegel Airport is very fast (20-25 minutes), and into the city center also very easy.. Public transport very easy in Berlin. Get the "Berlin Welcome Card", e.g. at the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Mommy
Reviews.Content: Pluses: relatively inexpensive rooms (66 euros plus 9 euro breakfast), proximity to airport (12-13 Euro taxi ride takes about 10 minutes), close to U Bahn station, grocery store in basement with many tasty and inexpensive food options, large health club nearby, nice rooms (clean, (basic and comfortable), plentiful breakfast with a pleasant dining room and helpful and efficient staff. Maybe the Moa has gotten a new chef since the other reviewers' visits - we found the food to be fine, well presented with fresh and good quality ingredients. In addition to breakfast every day, we had one lunch and one dinner in the hotel. The lunch, part of our conference/meeting, was a nice spicy soup and chicken with spinach/cheese filling. The dinner was a delicious ceasar salad with tender chicken and a variety of beautiful tender lettuces. Reasonably priced at about 7 Euros. Negatives: ground floor atrium-facing room had little privacy (had to keep the window shade down all the time or people could see right into the room), too many smokers in the lobby, the health club did not open until 11:00 a.m., the bathroom was too dimly lit and we (women) were told not to walk around the neighborhood after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MrAnders62
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near the center of Berlin, close to U-Bahn, helpful staff, super rooms, okay dinner, fantastic breakfast, we used a spot deal for a weekend stay when we take the price and experience against each other, our Appraisal that we got good value for money, we plan to return to the same hotel with friends. thanks for a nice stay. Sincerely, A. Jakobsen.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel - VERY bad food!”
Reviews.Author: Ida J
Reviews.Content: We went on a two day trip to this hotel. The rooms are very nice and clean, the staff are service minded and sweet. But the food is horrible... We got the meals included in the price, and we would rather have eaten out in the city - the food was tasteless and the restaurant looked like a cheep cantina... Go out instead of eating in!!! The location of the hotel is ok - but pretty far from the city center. The U-ban is close by, and that makes it a little better. So in total: God rooms, ok location and bad food!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a splendid breakfast! The restaurant in the hotel was very stylish with nice furnitures. However the dinner was not at all the standard the hotel othwerwise are aiming at. Skip the dinenr there but do have the breakfast there! It is located not very far from the centerwith a U-bahn station 200 m from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive dinner!...No way!”
Reviews.Author: Leifkrarup
Reviews.Content: Bought an offer that promised 2 days stay with an exclusive 3 course meal included. Hotel is ok if you like this sterile modern style. We don´t but can´t blame the hotel because we knew that before booking and it´s really a matter of preference. Do not choose this hotel if you have a tendency towards claustrofobicness. You really feel incapsulated in this hotel, all doors are electrically operated and windows opens only a little. I wondered what happens under a fire or an electricity power cut. No way doors an windows will allowe you to escape if the automatic systems fails. As my headline says the 3 course dinner was really lousy. On top on bad quality the courses were very small and we went to a nearby cafe to have some more to eat. The french wine recomended to us by the waiter (25 euro) was poor quality and we found the same in the ground floor supermarket at a price of about 2-3 euro. Last a funny thing! After having booked our stay we received an email with a document for printing attached. On the document was printed "Voucher" followed by a reference number. When we presented this document at the reception the young lady there told us: this is not the voucher, I replyed yes this is the voucher because it says so in the document, the young lady again stated: no this is not a voucher. What she really wanted was the print of the offer I bought online from a third hand party. But why is the hotel sending me a document saying it´s a voucher when it is not what they want????

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Nice Breakfast although slightly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is at a perfect location, no more than 2-3 minutes walks from Birkenstrasse U-Bahn, and from there you can travel around the city. Taxi fares to and from the airports (specifically Tegel) are reasonable and staff were more than happy to help book them. We were meeting out there and my flights were delayed, with the booking in my name and my partner arriving before me, we were worried the she might not be able to check in, but I phoned up and they were very flexible and happy to accomodate us. The room was always clean and comfortable although, we were given two single beds wedged together despite asking for a double room, but large clean bathroom and shower. Our only complete experience of the hotel was breakfast, and although the array of food was substantial there was little hot food. In our opinion there could have been options or a set of prices as the whole buffet was quite expensive and slightly cheaper options that might have included half the buffet would have been appreciated. Overall our stay was very nice and the time we spent at the hotel was comfortable and relaxing, the lounge area is nice after a day around the town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - Bad dinner”
Reviews.Author: Line J
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay. The staff was serviceminded, nice and very helpfull even before the stay. The room was comfortable and had a nice an modern design. Breakfast was god- high standard and nice variety. However the dinner was terrible. Tomatosoup warmed in a microwave (It tasted as if), chicken in a creamsauce, wich was definately not chicken, and the desert was simply uneatable.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: The room was awesome. TV decent size bathroom and a very comfortable King Size bed. The furniture was modern and not too cluttered. The breakfast was of a very high standard, for an Englishman like me there was the typical breakfast coupled with a respectable selection of all variety of breakfast food you can think of. The staff were polite and helpful and generally enhanced our stay at this very modern hotel. We planned to visit the sites around Berlin and the location of the hotel says exactly what it did on the tin, easy and quick to travel into this grand city. No complaints, many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good breakfast - not the best dinner”
Reviews.Author: Olesentravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and clean. It is easy to get around from the Ubahn stop close by. The staff is nice and very helpful. We got some excellent tips on finding a place to eat and how to get there. The hotel breakfast is really good, but out dinner there was not the most exciting experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Kathrine Dahl A
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and clean. The matrress was extremely hard but the staff was helpful in that matter. The best and very beautiful social area were unfortunately used by smokers, and didn't smell very good. We had a good experience contacting the staff, tough the evening staff in the restaurant wasn't very flexible. The breakfast was extremely good but our so called 3 course exclusive dinner was a joke! Overall lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: FABA1968
Reviews.Content: Spectacular design, very new and clean, practical bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Really cool”
Reviews.Author: LeRu
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel, pleasant staff, near the public transport (U-Bahn).I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Best price and quality”
Reviews.Author: 4apa
Reviews.Content: I was at the weekend in this hotel. Location is very good for me. It takes 10 minutes go to the Tegel airoport by taxi or 20 minutes by bus. Near hotel there is Birkenstraße‎ U-bach station line U9. Only 10 minutes and 3 stops by U-bach and you are at the Kurfürstendamm, where you can go shopping or take City Circle Tour by bus. Staff was helpful, room`s new and comfortable. The bathroom`s good and clean. You have tea maker in the room. There`s store on the ground floor. Hotel is on the first floor of the buildings. Reception has modern design.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with minor setbacks”
Reviews.Author: AbbyFrb
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Moa hotel in december 2011. It is well situated near public transport, and the staff was very helpfull in upgrading me to a new room right away because the sink was broken in my first room. The second room was large and luxurious, and everything was nice, new and clean. There is a large supermarket on the ground floor where you can stack up on fresh fruits, beer/wine, sweets etc. The hotel foyer includes a lagre smoking section which you pass on the way to the restaurant and bar, and it is definately not nice to have to smell smoke every time you walk by. But just don't linger and it's no big problem.The bar is tended by a very nice and friendly staffmember, and it was cosy to sit by the fireplace and enjoy our drinks, (maybe a little bit annoying that a tv screen was constantly blasting flickering pictures (soccer) right in the middle of the lounge section). The food is definately not anything to get exited over - we had an included 3 course set menu at the hotel which they kindly made vegetarian for me and my travelpartner, but it was just dull, unimaginative, covered in salt and grease and basically the worst food we got during our entire stay. So we didn't bother eating at the hotel again, but luckily there are som good restaurants near by and finding tasty food was no problem. The continental breakfast at the hotel is served in nice surroundings, the food is very classic (dull and includes rubbery cheese, hardboiled eggs, very processed and massproduced foods, but displayed nicely and presented professionally). Apart from one staffmember on one occasion misguiding me to a museum which turned out to be closed that day, my impression af the people working there is that they are friendly, professional and helpfull. And there is a high standard in regard to clenaliness and overall flexibility and excellent service. I would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jalandua
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel from reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I was not happy that we appeared to be so far from the city center, however this proved to be a bonus. The hotel was very good, the staff helpful and pleasant, the area fine. By staying so far from the city we got to use the U-Bahn and bus system to get around. TIP...the #100 and #200 buses that leave from the Zoo take you past all of the sights in downtown Berlin. No need to use the jump on jump off service organized by the more expensive operators. Just buy a day ticket from reception at the hotel...no commentary, but an easy way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, and some attempts at high standard - but it doesn't quite work”
Reviews.Author: Jeppe P
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some very nice rooms. But the big and impressive atrium is used for smoking, which results in a stench of cigarettes in the "non-smoking"rooms facing into the atriums, since the cleaners leaves the windows open, and deterring any non-smokers from using the atrium and lounge. The surroundings are uninspiring, but the U-Bahn is very close, and will take you to the heart of the city in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “weekend”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: The rooms were average - but the restaurant was really not a place you would want to sit too long, cold, far too bright light, and thats not speaking of the food, which was of a really poor standard, absolutly the worsed we have ever had at any hotel....you have to do much better, because your location is not the best, you have to go by car...The smoking area in the mittel of the hotel is the top of wrong doing, everything smells of smoke, you can't even open a window, because then your whole rooms smells like a smoking area too!! Absolutly not a hotel we will visit again

Reviews.Title: “Not a very sympatic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TineDenmark
Reviews.Content: We were to visit one night only in December to see the Christmas markets. Coming from Denmark the plan was to drive down but we were so unlucky that halfway there our car broke down. We were towed back to our starting point. I called the hotel at about 11 o'clock midday to tell them that we unfortunately would not be able to arrive. Now I have myself worked in hotels many years and must say I was very dissapointed with the level of service shown when I called. First of all I would have expected a "oh I am so sorry to hear your car has broken down" kind of thing. I asked if it would be possible to somehow move the reservation to another date. Here I got a "no" - If the hotel people had just a little bit of experience I think the best answer would have been "If we are able to sell the room to somebody else then it should be possible.. at this point we can not promise anything but we will try" This is alway an option for hotel staff and I believe it is also one of the better solution because like that they optimise their revenue and everybody would be happy.. But not here. They said no! and checked us in eventhough we did not arrive (this is done to make sure the hotel shows as full in the reports) and now we have received an email asking us if we had a nice journey back.. just to rub salt in.. and its writtten in an horrible english. For Christ sake.. Check your records and only let staff that speaks english write to english speaking customers. And last but not least.. show a bit of sympathy when bad things have occured to your guests!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, room, breakfast and average dinner”
Reviews.Author: Christoffer H
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a very nice stay at the hotel. The overall experience of the hotel was verry god. The room was very fine with a very nice bathroom. The breakfast got it all but the dinner meal at the restaurant could be better. Overall a very nice hotel 200 meters from a U-bahn ! Best regards from Denmark !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Svend B
Reviews.Content: Overall a good impression. Good beds, close to the city centre, not too noisy. I stayed in one of the rooms with a window to the atrium. If it had been summer, it had probably been a minus, but in the winter it's really not that big problem. That means also no street noise. I felt I slept in an ufo somewhere in the space, but it was a good trip. A big minus was unfortunately the restaurant on the evening I arrived. I'm not a very good cook, but I'm sure I could make it about so good or hopefully better. I hope the cook had a bad day. A four star hotel should offer much better food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Rabalderslev
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel for two nights in December and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel have very friendly staff and excellent service. Nice interior design, a great atrium, and the room is very nice and spacious. Parking is right next to the hotel and the U-Bahn Station is appr. 50 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mianne109
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in December and really enjoyed our stay. Very friendly staff and excellent service. Nice and welcoming lobby area. The rooms are clean and inviting. The air-conditioning was working extremely well. The room-darkening shades added some extra comfort. We enjoyed overlooking the large lobby area from our room-windows. Parking around the hotel was safe and available but a parking garage is offered as well. Wi-Fi was available throughout the hotel at no extra-charge. The restaurant staff was helpful and very friendly. The breakfast buffet offered a good variety of items and a pleasant atmosphere. We loved spending our evenings in the restaurant and enjoyed the fire-place and the ample and comfortable seating arrangements. Overall a very good hotel that we would stay in again. The only aspect we didn't like was the fact that smoking was allowed inside the large reception/atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern new hotel, very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: KeithBN
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin on business for a few days, ad to be honest I picked the Moa because it was geographically closest to where I needed to be. The hotel itself is very new (so new that most Internet ariel views are of barren wasteland!), and is built to a good standard, situated above a brand new supermarket and shopping mall (the hotel occupies the 2nd and 3rd floors, with reception on the 2nd floor). The lobby is breathtaking when you first encounter it. The staff were all friendly and very helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. The room itself was larger than I expected, and very nicely equipped with a very comfortable bed, chairs, work desk (of good seize) and the inevitable overpriced minibar. Bathroom has toilet, good basin and a shower (no bath), although the design of the shower screen and seal suggests the bathroom floor will get very wet after a few months as the seal wears out - a minor detail but something to watch for. WiFi is available for free via a unique username/password which you get from reception - note it will only work or a single device, so if you have say a laptop and an iPad or iPhone you will need to ask them for 2 access codes - which the hotel provided without any problems, but just something to note. The breakfast, a little on the pricey side but within normal hotel range, was the usual buffet affair with plenty of choice of cereals, cooked breakfast, breads, pastries, cold meats, cheeses and fruits; certainly enough to set one up for the day, and all served in a spacious, bright and airy restaurant. The evening meal selection, however, was rather sparse on the one night we ate there, a very limited menu which was frankly a little disappointing. On the plus side there are plenty of good places to eat near-by covering most price ranges, and the hotel staff were very happy to make suggestions and recommendations. On one of the nights the hotel suffered a failure of their boilers which meant no heating and no hot water for a night, a bit inconvenient but outwit their control. They got it fixed and gave everyone a free drink at the bar plus a complimentary room upgrade on next stay. Checkout was easy, I did mine the night before due to a VERY early start. Getting a taxi is very easy - reception press a button and a taxi is waiting for you downstairs within 4 minutes, day or night! All in all I enjoyed my stay and would certainly stay again if I'm in the area. Might eat out for a cheaper breakfast, though, and would definitely use the local restaurants for evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisinly Good and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxBhoy
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here through Expedia through my staff discounts at work. For four nights over the last weekend in October it came to £220 including expedia's fees. This was fantastic value.The only grumble I have is that expedia, not Best Western, say this hotel is in the Mitte, I wouldn't say it is. However it is not an unsafe neighbourhood, more an unexciting residential neighbourhood. The area around Turmstrasse, where you can get off the Tegel Bus (TXL) is not that nice and is very run down. This is one stop, or a 10 minute brisk walk away. I thought the hotel was first class, the staff always very helpful and friendly and the room excellent. There is free internet, the bathrooms are good with nice products. The hotel is strange at first in that there a massive enclosed internal courtyard with water features. Our room was on the quiet inside and we heard nothing. We had a large room despite only paying for a standard possibly (though not just) because I was a member of BW's reward scheme. I didn't eat in the hotel, however we paid more than 13 euros for breakfast in Berlin. Sunday brunches can be a little fancy in Berlin. The transport from the hotel is great, and if you are off to the east or other parts of the centre, it can be quicker to take the train up to Leopoldstrasse. One of the best reasons to stop at this hotel is that despite being in a residential neighbourhood there are some lovely and very good value eating and drinking options in the area. We ate dinner and lunch at Lichtblick, along near the U-bahn station. IIt was wonderful, mains from 7-15 euros and beers as little as 2.50 Euro for large. Very good quality food and excellent service, they do breakfast on Sundays as well. We also ate breakfast in Arema, an older more traditional bar/restaurant. Traditional german breakfast for 8 euros. Excellent value. You could add a glass of fizz if you want to for a euro. Also the large kebab shop near Arema was nice and opened late. On my first night the people from the bar directed me to this, saying they ate there, as they had stopped serving food at 11pm.There is also a small bakery doing among other things sandwiches and nice cakes, making it a good value. I didn't find a safe looking cash machine available nearby, I think because the shopping centre (postbank) and supermarket was closed and ended up at Turmstrasse at night. It didn't feel too bad, but I have lived in inner cities and am 6'2" and very large build, so I tend to not bother too much. I would get the bus to Turmstrasse unless you are nervous about travelling on your own, as my cab to the hotel from Hauptbahnof took a scenic route at over 7euros. Also worth noting that cabs are expensive in Berlin as it is a big city, much more like London than say Hamburg or Amsterdam and very spread out. One last tip is remember the size of the city and make allowances for travelling time, it is a large city and takes time to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “A great option for visitors to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JJJR
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel and were very impressed. The room was very comfortable and attractive. We were in a remarkably affordable Junior Suite with our two kids, who slept on the cozy pullout sofa. There are not that many options in Berlin for families with 2 kids unless you want to book two rooms, which we did not. So we were quite pleased. The lobby area has a very striking and pleasing design. Someone wrote here that there is nowhere to eat nearby, but there were plenty of restaurants right down the street. There is a little shopping center right there including a very convenient and nice supermarket, great for water or snacks or whatever. The U-bahn/subway is right nearby. So top points for convenience. We were highly satisfied all in all and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suprise at a comfortable price”
Reviews.Author: Cynicoren
Reviews.Content: Great stay, even though its a little far from the center. Clean, great service, young positive and polite personnel. They even helped us find clubs. It has an U-Bahn Station 50 meters away, and a small mall below with an Edeka branch. We stayed in an inner room (not a street room) and there was no noise. We counted on the 30 inch (I think, we didn't came with a ruler) flat screen TV about 80 channels - 40 in German, 6 in English , and the other in Korean, Japanese and other languages. The room was always clean, and large relatively to every other hotel we've been to in Europe. The design of the hotel is modern and has a smooth, flowing feel to it. They also have free WIFI internet. the only "problems" with this hotel are that the food is pretty expensive ( 7 Euros for a dry currywurst, 13 Euros for a breakfast), and it's a little for from main attractions in the city. To sum it up - we were a little sad to leaving...

Reviews.Title: “Extra clean with very good service”
Reviews.Author: LiberecKabs
Reviews.Content: Extra clean hotel, very good service. Not far from the city center, you can even walk. 10 minutes from the Charite Wirchow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: trishika
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a citybreak in early September, and it was a really good deal considering this is a 4-star hotel. The location is excellent, being extremely close to Birkenstrasse U-Bahn station which takes you to Zoologischer Garten S- and U-Bahn stations in about 10 minutes. In addition, the hotel is above a really big Edeka supermarket that sells everything that you'd might like to buy to make your visit more comfortable. The room is modern, clean and well decorated, and the bathroom is new and comfortable as well. The room has a mini fridge containing a few minibar items, but you can easily go down to the supermarket and maybe buy a few drinks, milk or yoghurt and store them in the fridge as well, to save some money. In addition, our room had free wireless internet which was very easy to connect to, and was a very fast speed. We arrived by Tegel airport and it was very easy to reach this hotel via bus 109 to Zoologischer Garten and then taking the U9 U-Bahn to Birkenstrasse. In addition you can take X9 to Zoologischer Garten S- and U-Bahn or TXL to Alexanderplatz S- and U-Bahn. The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful and the lobby is also a lovely sight. We didn't go to the restaurant, but the staff there were friendly as well. Overall, a great hotel, and I really recommend this as a base for your visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “confusing at the beginning but very nice at the end”
Reviews.Author: carlosmatt
Reviews.Content: This is a newly refurnished hotel with lovely interior designed rooms, great atrium reception and services available. Neatly clean and comfortable rooms and staff very professional. What is confusing about the hotel is the access to it. It stands next to a mall (next to a big store supermarket). The reception is not on the ground floor but the second floor. But once inside, everything is nice. The location is not that great but it is 2 minutes from the metro station. In few minutes you can reach any point of berlin mitte. For a short trip or longer trip is worthy to try and you have free wireless connection. I didn't try the breakfast but i heard it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davina D
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin for my brother in laws 50th birthday and stayed for 3 nights. After reading reviews we were worried about the location of the hotel but it was not a problem. The subway is literally on the door step, trams arrive every few minutes and the hotel is only a few stops away from the major attractions. Although there is little night life near the hotel there are a few bars (particularly good is the Arena) where we finished our days with a night cap. Our rooms were excellent, spacious,well decorated, great wet rooms and most important fantastic beds. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast is a little expensive (£13) and limited if you like a cooked breakfast but there is plenty otherwise on offer to keep you going well into the afternoon. Highlights of the trip were the open top bus tour (excellent value for money), 'Topography of terror' (a free museum) and the Berlin walks 'Buildings of the Third Reich' (Finn you are a great guide and made the walk educational and entertaining). Checkpoint Charlie and Jewish museum a little disappointing. Would advise to visit the Holocaust memorial rather than Jewish museum. Overall a very interesting and moving weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytravelfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week for a sightseeing trip to Berlin. The hotel is not really in the city centre, but just 100m away from the subway station "Birkenstrasse" and therefore within easy reach of anywhere in Berlin you want to go. Berlin´s public transport system is one of the best I have ever experienced anywhere. The hotel has been open for about 1 year and is brand new. The rooms are very comfortable and very clean. Breakfast it great and all staff is very friendly. The hotel is adjacent to a small shopping mall with a large supermarket so you can get snacks, drinks, etc if you don´t want to eat out all the time. The hotel has a nice restaurant though and there are a couple of bars and take-out places nearby. Can´t wait to return to this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price-Value Ratio”
Reviews.Author: Johannes50
Reviews.Content: The BW Moa hotel in Berlin is a very new, very stilish hotel with an excellent price-value ratio. Close to a underground station you within 6 minutes at the "Kurfuerstendamm" and the "KDW" (a very good and wellknown store-house). Also look for the restaurant, there you will find some fresh food for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel poor location”
Reviews.Author: maddydavidson
Reviews.Content: Having spent a week in this hotel although the rooms were spacious and the beds comfortable we found the hotel quite lacking in character. The restaurant choice was very poor and we thought it was expensive compared with other restaurants we used in Berlin. The standard of cleanliness in the room was disappointing and twice they came in to do the room up whilst we were still in there and this was before 8.30am There was little to do in the area around the hotel in the evening apart from visiting a couple of small cafes. For any life at all you had to go into the centre of Berlin. On a positive note the breakfast was excellent. I feel the hotel is more suited to business people not holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel, quiet neighborhood location.”
Reviews.Author: MNGophers2000
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is months old, so therefore it is still clean and new, along with well-taken care of by staff. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is very quiet and close to the Birkenstrasse S-bahn station. There is a grocery store in the building as well.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: cnsDerby
Reviews.Content: Agree with other review hotel is located in a run down area, however we had a very good deal through the Co-op for our stay at this hotel. The breakfast was very good as was the room & facilities. The U-band station was just across the road. Nearby bar/ restuarant Arema did very good food & beers & priced as expected for Berlin.The Berlin ABC card is worth getting - note this is valid for 72 hours from time of validation. Tickets must be validated in the boxes on the platforms. Berlin Zoo is worth a visit, visits to the Reichstag must be pre- booked on the net & the dome was closed to all visitors. Visit the Brandanberg Gate as soon as possible as this can be closed off to the public due to visiting VIPS & guests at the nearby hotel Adlon. Dont miss the TV Tower & Alexanderplatz area. We had a great time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “OK until you come to pay”
Reviews.Author: Malevisitor
Reviews.Content: Price of rooms was OK. Breakfast good but fairly expensive. On checkout the reception demanded an extra 50€ because my daughters' room was "very dirty". On further investigation this turned out to relate to no more than one fairly small stain on the wall, that they claimed would require a painter. I used a damp cloth to remove the offending stain in about 20 seconds. I then suggested to the hotel reception that I should have a refund for doing their cleaners' job for them. This met with a refusal, although they did waive the 50€. All of this took time and it was very fortunate that we were not in a hurry to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable and stylish.”
Reviews.Author: mick809
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 3 nights at this superb hotel. Very quick check-in and despite only having a basic room it was spacious, and the shower was as large as a wet-room. The buffet-breakfast was very good, although I would have liked a fried egg. Despite being located a few kilometres north of the centre in Moabit, it is within 200 metres of U-Bhf Birkenstrasse which is 3 stops from the Zoologischer Garten terminal. We loved this hotel, although we can't really comment on the value as we utilised some airmiles to reduce the cost. Our fourth time in Berlin and a useful tip is to buy a Berlin Welcome Card ABC zones at the airport; this will give you unlimited travel on public transport within about 15 miles radius of the centre, and also reduced prices at some attractions.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Hotel Moa Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Stephanstrasse 41 | Tiergarten, 10559 Berlin, Germany
